right. I’ll be back

Hello community,

The company that I am working with is debating if is a good practice to build websites in staging or not after an issue that we found with staging where if you build your pages in staging, and after that connect a new domain to the HS portal, the staging pages are gone missing and we have to talk to the support team to bring them back for us.  Is this a known issue or is something intentional? If is an issue, is there an estimate time until is going to be fixed? Based on your answer we are probably going to change our approach with staging pages because that issue happens a lot on our end.

Kind Regards

We ran across that before also. This is how we prevent it now.

If a website already has existing pages that are on a domain then we stage.

If the existing pages are not on the domain, then we build straight into website pages using HubSpot default domain. 

If the domain is not set on the page by page, Then it should be a global update when you switch your domain
There is such thing as a json file without the extention but unless your headers are right it wont read it as such it will read it as just a document
you can build your pages.. take them live and then add the domain.
hi <@U25C65C3S> for the last row, you mean to still work on the website pages and when everything is ready, we just make the DNS changes to point to the new domain, right?
Yes, all in website pages
Change your default and it’s global
Staging is domain based
that's what we will also do most probably, but if only that issue were to be fixed, we wouldn't really worry and build always straight into staging
yeah. it would be nice if staging was not only domain based but by default followed the domain of the type of page you are working on unless you tell it otherwise...
I like staging, is safe and I also have a live link to test HubDB. I noticed that if you do dynamic pages with HubDB in order for the link to the dynamic page to work, needs to be live, right?
i.e. Website pages always stay with that domain and landing pages with its own domain.
no.
You can fake it.

We do the same as <@U25C65C3S>
Existing CMS website : STAGING
New CMS website : ON HubSpot and after changing domain
`{% set dynamic_page_hubdb_table_id = <YOUR_HUBDB_TABLE_ID> %}`
you mean to add {{request.url}}/name   ?
just remember to remove it when you take the pages live
cause this over rides the HubSpot default variable
yep, that's why if you do it on a live link, you don't have to worry about it
:wink:
so that means the issue is not on a priority task and is not going to be fixed in the near future, right?
Probably.
it is a "feature"
'is not a bug, is an undocumented feature' :joy:
ok, thanks a lot for the info guys :slightly_smiling_face:
The easiest way is for them to enable CORS for your domain on their server
HubSpot will not block CORS call ?
CORS is enabled on the remote server
ok
There is this as well.. <https://cors-anywhere.herokuapp.com/>
you could spin up your own if you dont trust the source
thanks a lot for your time
no prob
Did you figure it out?

Should work: <https://knowledge.vidyard.com/hc/en-us/articles/360009871074-The-Vidyard-Player-browser-and-device-compatibility>
